docs.lead_paragraph: Defensive tackle Kris Jenkins, a four-time Pro Bowl selection, announced his retirement on his Facebook page Wednesday after his last two seasons with the Jets were cut short by serious knee injuries. ''Wanted to let you all know that I have loved the support and respect that you all have given me throughout my career,'' Jenkins wrote. ''But it is time for the torch to be passed to the younger players. I am going to hang up the cleats!''
docs.abstract: New York Jets defensive tackle Kris Jenkins announces his retirement; other football items noted. Photo (M)2

docs.lead_paragraph: DUCKLER--Naomi Weinstein, died on July 17 at her home in the Catalina Foothills, in Tucson, AZ, surrounded by her four children and husband, Marvin Ira Duckler. She was to celebrate her 80th birthday, and 60th wedding anniversary this year. Born in Brooklyn, NY, Naomi held Bachelor's and Master's degrees in Nutrition and Food Science from Brooklyn College. Mother, nurturer, and beloved by her four children: Ariel Eva Duckler-Levy; Mordecai (Max) Sam Duckler; Ana Miryam Duckler Forest; Sara Rebecca Duckler. Proud grandmother of ten grandchildren, David, Lily, Gali, Nadav, Eva, Matan, Adam, Benjamin, Isabella, and Rachel. She is also survived by her two brothers, William Weinstein of Toronto, Canada, and the Hon. Judge Jack B. Weinstein, of the E.D.N.Y. Naomi was a mensch, with a beautiful character who always wanted everyone to be happy. A gentle and intelligent sense of humor, and a love and appreciation for all. She will be profoundly missed for her brilliant smile and laughter, sparkling blue eyes, her innocence and worldliness, her purity, truth, decency, honesty, faithfulness, her humor and generosity; a woman of honor and love. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to your preferred charity.
